result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark J Kovach Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: One day jail credit if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

No possession or consumption of alcohol.
No entry into any bars or taverns.

Must undergo Anger Management Assessment, follow through with all recommendations and must be successful in program.
Take all medications as prescribed by treating physician and follow any and all aftercare programs.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within first six (6) months of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Same conditions of probation as count 1 with no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count 1

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark J Kovach Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for judgment on court ordered financial obligations

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark J Kovach in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:20 PM. Also called 13CF10 and 15CM56. Agent Joan VanCleve also in Court. State - here for modification of probation, agent asking for 60 days in jail as a probation modification. Kovach makes statement. Court instructs the defendant on what is happening today for stated reasons (read probation paperwork provided). Court instructs defendant of his rights for today and his right to an attorney. Kovach makes statement but Court warns him of making statements that may come back to harm him. Court explains the process for today. Court sets for a hearing and refers the matter to SPD. Kovach states he will take the two months that P&P is asking for. Court will make no ruling at this point and P&P can go and talk to the defendant at FOSO

Defendant Mark J Kovach in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie Bednar appears for State of Wisconsin. Called 1:44 pm. Burns - joint recommendation plead to Count 1 as alleged with an imposed and stayed sentence of 90 days in FC jail, stayed and place on probation for 18 months. Count 2 - imposed and stayed, 9 months in FC jail (consecutive to count 1) stayed, place on probation for 18 months - Conditions of probation: costs on both counts, 75 hours of community service (on one count only), AODA, anger management and follow thru, no entry into any bars or taverns, no possession or consumption of alcohol ,all other standard probation conditions. Defendnat pleads G to count 1 and NC to count 2. Court goes thru plea questionnaire freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering plea and waiving right to JT, factual basis, accepts plea adjudges guility of counts 1 & 2. State/Burns make statement. Kovach makes statement apologizes. 
Court sentences to the following: count 1 -  imposed and stayed sentence of 90 days in FC jail, stayed and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of costs, 75 hours of community service to be completed within first 6 months of probation, AODA follow thru, anger management and follow thru - must be successful in program, take all medications as prescribed by treating physician, follow all aftercare programs, no entry into any bars or taverns, no possession or consumption of alcohol, Full time employment/school with verbage. Count 2 - imposed and stayed, 9 months in FC jail (consecutive to count 1) stayed, place on probation for 18 months - same conditions of probation as count 1 with no additional community service. 1 day credit if revoked. Appeal rights given. Adj.

Defendant Mark J Kovach in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:11 AM. Burns has complaint, has gone over it with the defendant, waives reading of it, enters NG plea to all counts. Court continues bond, accepts plea, set for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with grandmother and Uncle Chris.
